title: Object Pool With Multiplayer Support
description: Enhance your game's performance with the Networked Pool System, a simple and robust solution for object pooling in multiplayer and offline games.
longDescription:
Demo Project

Demo Video

Networked Pool System is a powerful Unreal Engine plugin designed to streamline object pooling for both offline and networked multiplayer games. By reusing actors and objects instead of constantly spawning and destroying them, this plugin significantly improves performance and reduces lag, making your gameplay smoother and more responsive.

Key Features:

  • Seamless Network Integration: Automatically syncs pooled objects across clients and servers, eliminating the need for manual replication setups.
  • Easy Setup and Use: Minimal configuration needed. Replace default functions with pool-specific ones and get started immediately.
  • Blueprint and C++ Support: Provides both K2 nodes and ability tasks, making it accessible whether you prefer working in Blueprints or C++.
  • Automatic Resets: The plugin automatically resets variables and components, reducing the need for tedious manual adjustments.

Use Cases:

  • Optimize Game Performance: Ideal for games with high object spawn rates, such as shooters with numerous projectiles or strategy games with many units.
  • Simplify Development: Focus on game design without worrying about the complexities of networking pooled objects.
  • Scalable and Flexible: Suitable for small indie projects and large-scale multiplayer games alike.

Links to Resources:

  • Documentation
technicalDetails:
Technical Information

Features:

  • Seamless network integration with automatic replication of active states and transforms across clients.
  • Automatic resetting of variables and component activation/deactivation for easy reuse of pooled objects.
  • Blueprint and C++ support with dedicated K2 nodes and ability tasks for simple implementation.
  • Minimal setup requiredâ€”replace standard Unreal functions with pool-specific ones to get started quickly.
  • Flexible configuration options, including exclusion lists for properties that should not be automatically reset.
  • Optimized for high-performance scenarios, reducing lag and improving game responsiveness.

Code Modules:

  • NetworkedPoolSystem (Runtime)
  • NetworkedPoolSystemDeveloper (Developer)

Number of Blueprints:

  • 0

Number of C++ Classes:

  • 11 C++ Classes supporting pooling functionality

Network Replicated:

  • Yes

Supported Development Platforms:

  • Windows, Linux

Supported Target Build Platforms:

  • Windows, Linux, PlayStation, Xbox
